DOC.brief_summary: In study , investigator compare analgesic effect bupivacaine bupivacaine-dexmetomedine elective cesarean delivery perform bilateral TAP block , patient operation perform general anesthesia .
DOC.brief_title: Transverse Abdominal Block Analgesia Casarean Section
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator study 60 ASA [ American Society Anesthesiologist ] physical status I ІІ patient undergo elective cesarean delivery tanta University Hospital , prospective , randomize , comparative , clinical trial . Patients randomly allocate two equal group ( n = 30 ) use closed envelope label 1 , 2 reflect group 1and 2 respectively . The drug prepared anesthesiologist involve study data collection . Group I : ( n=30 ) receive pre-delivery bilateral TAP block 10 ml bupivacaine 0.5 % mixed 10 ml saline 10 μg dexmetonedine 20 ml syringe label G 2 . Group II : ( n=30 ) receive post-delivery bilateral TAP block 10 ml bupivacaine 0.5 % mixed 10 ml saline 20 ml syringe label G2 .
DOC.criteria: 1 . We study 60 ASA [ American Society Anesthesiologist ] physical status I ІІ patient undergo elective cesarean delivery 2 . Age 2140 year old . 1 . Refusal participation study 2 . Patients infection tumor site puncture local anesthetic injection . 3 . Patients coagulopathy , platelet abnormality , concurrent treatment anticoagulant drug . 4 . Patients know allergy sensitivity dexmetomedine , and/or bupivacaine 5 . Severe hepatic and/or renal insufficiency 6 . Morbid obesity ( body mass index ( BMI ) > 35 ) 7 . Psychological disease
